page.title: 14FISHERIES MANAGER ROMSEY
page.content: Mr Aldridge's favourite time of year is the spring when everything goes green and starts to come alive. He enjoys helping people to use their tackle correctly and he can show them where the fish like to lie in the river. This part of the River Test is split up into twelve beats and two fishermen can fish for salmon or trout on each one. It costs thirty pounds a day each. There are four men looking after the twelve beats. They have to spend a lot of time repairing breakwaters, making bridges and clearing weed from the river bed. It can be miserable in the winter. The young trout also have to be reared and fed. He often works from 8 am until 8 pm but he loves the outdoor life. When Mr Aldridge does have a few days off, away from his job at Broadlands, he likes to do a spot of fishing.
